channel.title: Jad Dropping Fire Cape
channel.description:
Alright, So I've spawned [i]two[/i] TzTok-Jad's (Jad).
I wanted them to drop a fire cape every time one dies. So I opened up npcdrops.cfg and found npcdrop = 2745. (Jad's ID). Then I changed the code for him to drop [b]one[/b] fire cape everytime he dies.
Here's the line of code represent Jad's drop in npcdrops.cfg [code] npcdrop = 2745 5 6570 1 [/code]
What's wrong with it? And could anyone care to explain what DropType is?
Thanks in advance -TeleNubby

item.title: Jad Dropping Fire Cape
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

My

public void MonsterDropItem

Is completely quoted out, so it means I dont use that.

What would be the problem then?

Read full topic

item.title: Jad Dropping Fire Cape
item.dc:creator: @getsome getsome
item.description:
@getsome wrote:

npcdrops.cfg doesnt work in most sources what the guy above said should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Jad Dropping Fire Cape
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

you can use npchandler …

in it search public void MonsterDropItem

then under one of the existing ones put

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == ####) { ItemHandler.addItem(####, npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

change the #'s to the jads id and the item id you want it to drop

Read full topic

item.title: Jad Dropping Fire Cape
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Alright, So I’ve spawned two TzTok-Jad’s (Jad).

I wanted them to drop a fire cape every time one dies. So I opened up npcdrops.cfg and found npcdrop = 2745. (Jad’s ID). Then I changed the code for him to drop one fire cape everytime he dies.

Here’s the line of code represent Jad’s drop in npcdrops.cfg

npcdrop = 2745		5		6570	1

What’s wrong with it? And could anyone care to explain what DropType is?

Thanks in advance
-TeleNubby

Read full topic
